articles.headline: Fed Efforts to Revive Economy Find Critics
articles.snippet: Ben S. Bernanke, the Fed chairman, may long for some of the praise that was once lavished on Alan Greenspan.
articles.abstract: Ben S. Bernanke, the Fed chairman, may long for some of the praise that was once lavished on Alan Greenspan.
articles.lead_paragraph: Can you remember when the Federal Reserve was above criticism? When politicians vied for Alan Greenspan’s favor and fell all over themselves praising his wisdom?

articles.headline: Japan’s Farmers Oppose Pacific Free-Trade Talks
articles.snippet: The idea of a vast free-trade zone of Pacific countries pits Japan’s farmers, who benefit from tariffs, against the country’s exporters.
articles.abstract: The idea of a vast free-trade zone of Pacific countries pits Japan’s farmers, who benefit from tariffs, against the country’s exporters.
articles.lead_paragraph: IWAMIZAWA, Japan  Atsushi Kono considers it the gravest threat to his family’s farm in a century of rice-growing: a free-trade initiative that could dismantle Japan’s sky-high protective farming tariffs, finally opening up the country to cheap, foreign produce.

articles.headline: Assertive Chinese Held in Mental Wards
articles.snippet: Activists say confinements in mental hospitals appear to be rising as authorities feel pressure to quell social unrest.
articles.abstract: Activists say confinements in mental hospitals appear to be rising as authorities feel pressure to quell social unrest.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOUHE, China — Xu Lindong, a poor village farmer with close-cropped hair and a fourth-grade education, knew nothing but decades of backbreaking labor. Even at age 50, the rope of muscles on his arms bespoke a lifetime of hard plowing and harvesting in the fields of his native Henan Province.
articles.byline: By Sharon LaFraniere and Dan Levin

articles.headline: Newsweek and Daily Beast Have a Deal
articles.snippet: Tina Brown has re-entered the world of print in a deal between The Daily Beast and Newsweek.
articles.abstract: Tina Brown has re-entered the world of print in a deal between The Daily Beast and Newsweek.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tina Brown is back in the world of print.

articles.headline: Start-Ups Follow Twitter, and Become Neighbors
articles.snippet: Hoping some of Twitter’s success will rub off on them, start-ups jostle to rent offices in the same San Francisco building.
articles.abstract: Hoping some of Twitter’s success will rub off on them, start-ups jostle to rent offices in the same San Francisco building.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  When Joe Fernandez, a tech entrepreneur, moved his start-up here last spring, a big goal, he said, was “to be best friends with the Twitter guys.” His theory was that by hanging around with executives at one of the hottest tech companies today, some of the magic could rub off.

articles.headline: To Congress With the Mantra, ‘Why Not Me?’
articles.snippet: The new Congress will contain the highest number of political newcomers in decades.
articles.abstract: The new Congress will contain the highest number of political newcomers in decades.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOLINE, Ill. — Bobby Schilling has spent the last decade perfecting his pizza crust. (The secret? A hint of whole wheat flour in the dough.) But this year, like dozens of other previously apolitical Americans, the cheerful father of 10 looked at the Congressional candidate arena and got to thinking, “Hey, why not me?”

articles.headline: Deficit Reduction Plan Draws Scorn From Left and Right
articles.snippet: President Obama’s bipartisan debt-reduction commission has exposed fissures in both parties, underscoring the volatile nature of addressing the nation’s budget problems.
articles.abstract: President Obama’s bipartisan debt-reduction commission has exposed fissures in both parties, underscoring the volatile nature of addressing the nation’s budget problems.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  By putting deep spending cuts and substantial tax increases on the table, President Obama’s bipartisan debt-reduction commission has exposed fissures in both parties, underscoring the volatile nature and long odds of any attempt to address the nation’s long-term budget problems.
